title: The wonderful thing this mum is doing after the tragic death of her newborn son who died an hour after birth
text:
News The wonderful thing this mum is doing after the tragic death of her newborn son who died an hour after birth Jessica Young, 23, and Aaron Young can be seen holding their son Oliver who died last year shortly after his birth Share This heartbreaking picture shows Jessica Young, 23 and husband Aaron Young cradling their dying son (Photo: Kent Live) Share Get   
This heartbreaking picture shows a devastated young couple cradling their son who died just one hour after he was born. 
Jessica Young, 23, and Aaron Young can be seen holding their son Oliver who died last year shortly after his birth. 
During pregnancy, a scan revealed a lack of amniotic fluid and Oliver was later diagnosed with Potter's Syndrome. 
The condition affects the development of kidneys and most babies with it are stillborn and ones that aren't usually only live for a maximum of two days. 
Despite Oliver's health concerns, the couple bravely decided to see the pregnancy through to give him a chance of defying the odds because they could see him "bouncing around" and was otherwise healthy. Read More Amazingly heartwarming footage shows nurses form impromptu band to sing with boy battling cancer Jessica and Aaron are pictured together (Photo: Kent Live) 
Jessica, from Ramsgate, told Kent Live : "We held on to hope. We chose to carry full term and let nature take its course. It was an impossible decision. I feel we made the right choice. Oliver heard us tell him how much we loved him. 
"All he ever knew was love. He fell to sleep peacefully. 
"He was beautiful and we got to spend so much time with him, using the cold blanket that was provided. He lived for one hour and surprised all the staff. We never want his memory to be forgotten." 
The 23-year-old has since been on a mission to raise money for the bereavement suite at the QEQM Hospital in Margate after her son's death on March 30, 2016. 
So far, Jessica has raised around £1,300 and is expecting that figure to rise significantly at the next event. 
Jessica added: "Evolve Salon & Wellness Spa, where I work, have been so helpful and raised a lot of money for the bereavement suite as well – we will have a big cheque being donated on the day. Mum Jessica is now raising money for her local hospital (Photo: Kent Live) 
"We have also purchased and donated a camera which will be used to take photos of babies and families from labour to dressing and cuddling their still born or shortly lived child." 
The couple said they plan to try and have kids again in the future and Jessica wants to raise awareness so other parents feel they can talk about children they've lost. 
She said: "No parent should ever have to go through this unimaginable heartache. When I had Oliver, I was right next to the labour ward and could see and hear babies being born – it was traumatic." 
Jessica also runs the Facebook group 'Potter's Syndrome Awareness in memory of Oliver Michael Mark Young' where she said she has been contacted by "so many parents" who have felt comforted by the group. Like us on Facebook
